candidates.reason:
{

candidates.comment: MOSFET or metal-oxide-semiconductor field-effect transistor is a type of field-effect. On this video the main type of mosfet talked was n type and logic level mosfet. Logic level mosfet only needs 5V to run. And the resistance from drain to source is low.  The drain- source voltage is important in selecting mosfet. Mosfet with high VDSS rating tend to have large onstate resistance, RDS(ON). With downside being increased conduction loss.

candidates.reason: The comment discusses specific design considerations for an H bridge driver, including the use of gate resistors and pull-down resistors, which are directly related to the topic's description of designing a high-power H bridge driver.
candidates.comment: One tip the speaker gives is the to include a gate resistor so that the input does not go directly into the MOSFET. Another benefit of the gate resistor is general ease of calculation; without it, the resistance and current in the connection to the MOSFET is more difficult to distinguish. Another necessity to a MOSFET circuit is a pull-down resistor connected to the MOSFET and ground and puts the MOSFET in a default state. The speaker also explains that a gate driver is the device used to power the MOFSET circuit on and off. The gate driver’s OUTH input sources the MOSFET while the OUTL input drains the MOSFET. The speaker in the video utilizes a simulation to better illustrate his ideas.
candidates.url: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=56p3_aORiJ0&t=22s: Designing Power MOSFET Circuits – Circuit Tips and Tricks
